ygData.subject: RE: Wind-practicing spots
ygData.msgSnippet: I practiced brass skill in the tunnel yesterday afternoon.  I went up to my max in just about 3-4 hours.  It was really funny though because when I got back
ygData.messageBody:
I practiced brass skill in the tunnel yesterday afternoon. I went up to my
max in just about 3-4 hours. It was really funny though because when I got
back after dinner, there were players standing around wondering why I was
dancing with my horn.... because everytime they walked within range the song
would make them glow and I would do a silly jig.. I wouldn't have noticed
but I was in external view.

Sevin
18th level human bard
on Brell

-----Original Message-----
From: Bard [mailto:dabard@...]
Sent: Saturday, September 04, 1999 12:55 PM
To: eqbards@onelist.com
Subject: [eqbards] Wind-practicing spots


From: "Bard" <dabard@...>

Personally, I have found many spots to practice my Wind and Brass skills. A
few choice locales that are easy to get to are:
1. Follow the right hand wall as you leave Qeynos, heading to QHills. As
soon as you zone into QHills you will be in a spot that no MOBs go anywhere
near. Make sure you have plenty of food and drink, equip the appropriate
instrument/song combo, and go see a movie while your character skills away.
2. As you leave HPH going into EK, follow the left wall to where it opens
up and allows you to go relatively far up the wall. No one and nothing EVER
goes there. Set the character up with the appropriate song/instrument
combo, and grab a good night's sleep.
As a good rule of thumb, any place in along a zone's edge where folks
usually don't go (for lack of MOBs to kill, merchants, etc) is a good place
:o)

-=B=-
I like 21 so much I've gona back to it several times now :oP

PS: Will killing the Kerrans over and over ruin my faction with
anything/anyone important? The only faction hit is to Prexuz (sp?) the
Oceanlord.
